lom:description.lom:string: The present project has been undertaken by the Education Interaction Department of Nortel Networks, a Canadian-based communications company, and a high school CS/Math teacher from Earl of March Secondary School, Kanata, Ontario, in conjunction with researchers at the University of Ottawa. Additional funding and web-server space have been provided by the Information Highway Applications Branch of Industry Canada, which has resulted in the expansion of the project. This project has been developed to investigate the factors that contribute to low rates of enrollment in high technology education programs, particularly among female students, and to develop strategies and interventions to promote high technology education. As part of this project, we have been examining the effects of offering all-female CS classes. Keywords: gender equity, women and information technology

lom:title.lom:string: Bridging the Gender Gap in Computer Science Education
